Rochester_Hills.Utica, Michigan:
Utica is a city in Macomb County in the U.S. state of Michigan. The population was 4,757 at the 2010 census.


== History ==
The city now known as Utica was platted by Joseph Stead in 1829, who preferred to call it "Harlow." Others referred to the city as "Hog's Hollow" or "McDougalville," until a few years later it was finally named Utica by settlers from New York, in honor of the city of the same name in that state.
